children.name: disadvantage
children.definition: a bad feature of sth, for example a way in which it causes problems or is worse than other things of the same kind: bất lợi
examples: The proposal has some major disadvantages.

children.name: disadvantage of
examples: The main disadvantage of being a nurse is working irregular hours.

children.name: drawback
children.definition: a disadvantage of something, that makes it seem less attractive - use this especially when something seems good in other ways: nhược điểm, hạn chế
examples: ▪It’s a good-looking car - the only drawback is the price.

children.name: drawback of
examples: ▪One of the major drawbacks of being famous is the lack of privacy.

children.name: drawback to
examples: ▪High house prices are one drawback to economic growth.

children.name: limitations
children.definition: the limits on how good sb/sth can be or what they are able to do: hạn chế
examples: I think we’ve done a wonderful job, considering the limitations we’ve had to work under.
We made an inspection of the building’s resources and limitations.

children.name: have limitations
examples: The system does have its limitations.

children.name: place limitations on something
examples: Spending limitations have been placed on the council's housing budget.

children.name: impose limitations on something
children.definition: an emphatic way of saying to place limitations on something
examples: The government has imposed severe limitations on the types of food that can be imported.

children.name: overcome limitations
children.definition: alsotranscend limitationsformal
examples: (= do more than you would normally be able or allowed to do )Can men and women ever transcend the limitations of their roles?

children.name: know/recognize limitations
children.definition: know what your qualities or abilities will allow you to do
examples: Know your limitations, and don't exercise too hard or you'll get injured.

children.name: accept the limitations of something
examples: Take pride in your achievements, but accept your limitations.

children.name: expose/reveal/show something's/somebody's limitations
children.definition: show where something or someone is not very good
examples: The film shows his limitations as a actor.

children.name: severe/serious/important limitations
examples: This approach to the problem has serious limitations.

children.name: inherent limitationsformal
children.definition: limitations that are a natural part of something
examples: We recognize the inherent limitations of our research.

children.name: technical limitations
examples: This odd effect on the film results from technical limitations in the video equipment.

children.name: physical limitations
examples: He has physical limitations which prevent him from lifting heavy objects.

children.name: practical limitations
examples: Practical limitations, such as a shortage of equipment, may prevent them from achieving their goal.

children.name: legal limitations
children.definition: limitations because of law
examples: Certain legal limitations are placed on the scope of Parliament's power.

children.name: limitation of
examples: Despite the limitations of the survey, it did suggest some general trends.
It’s a good little car, but ithasitslimitations.

children.name: downside
children.definition: the  the disadvantage of a plan or situation that in most other ways seems good: nhược điểm, mặt trái
examples: ▪ The band sounds great. The only downside is the quality of the recording.

children.name: the downside of
examples: ▪The downside of the New Economy is the forced resettlement of villagers.

children.name: sth make you unlikely to be successful
disadvantage
children.definition: something that causes problems, or that makes someone or something less likely to be successful or effectiveOPP advantage

children.name: the main disadvantage
examples: The main disadvantage of iron as a material is its weight.

children.name: a big/great/major disadvantage
examples: This method has one major disadvantage: its cost.

children.name: a serious/severe disadvantage
examples: Public transport is very bad here, which is a serious disadvantage.

children.name: a slight/minor disadvantage
examples: Children who are young in their school year sometimes have a slight disadvantage.

children.name: a further/additional/added disadvantage
examples: It’s a very small garden and it has the further disadvantage of facing north.

children.name: social/economic/educational disadvantage
examples: Unemployment often leads to social disadvantage.

children.name: have a disadvantage
examples: Cheap air travel has considerable environmental disadvantages.

children.name: suffer
children.definition: from
examples: a disadvantageformal Working-class boys suffer disadvantages in the educational system.

children.name: overcome a disadvantage
children.definition: succeed in spite of a disadvantage
examples: She was able to overcome the disadvantages of race and poverty.

children.name: somebody is at a disadvantage
children.definition: someone has a disadvantage
examples: The company was at a disadvantage compared with its competitors.

children.name: put/place somebody at a disadvantage
children.definition: make someone less likely to be successful than others
examples: Not speaking English might put you at a disadvantage.

children.name: be/work to the disadvantage of somebody
children.definition: make someone unlikely to be successful
examples: This system works to the disadvantage of women.

children.name: advantages and disadvantages
children.definition: the good and bad features of something
examples: Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of working from home.

children.name: the advantages outweigh the disadvantages
children.definition: there are more advantages than disadvantages
examples: The advantages of building the new road would outweigh the disadvantages.

children.name: disadvantage of
examples: The disadvantage of the material is that it fades in strong sunlight.

children.name: disadvantage to
examples: There are some big disadvantages to marriage – you do lose a lot of your freedom.
Criminal behaviour can be linked to economic disadvantage.

children.name: handicap
children.definition: something that prevents you from doing something as well as you could: trở ngại, bất lợi
examples: Not being able to drive is a real handicap if you live in the country.

children.name: handicap of
examples: The team had a good season despite the handicap of having 5 new players.

children.name: be a handicap to sb
examples: His lack of height has not been a handicap to him. He is as good an athlete as anyone else in the school.

children.name: have a disadvantage
children.definition: gặp bất lợi
examples: ▪She has the same qualifications as the other candidates, but has one big disadvantage - lack of experience.
Cô có bằng cấp tương đương với các ứng viên khác, nhưng có một bất lợi lớn - thiếu kinh nghiệm.
▪ Their restaurant has the disadvantage of being located south of town, a little too far from the tourist routes.
Nhà hàng của họ có bất lợi về việc nằm ở phía nam thị trấn, có chút quá xa các tuyến đường du lịch.

children.name: at a disadvantage
children.definition: be   to have a disadvantage, especially because you do not have the experience or qualities that make you more likely to succeed in doing something: ở thế bất lợi
examples: ▪ Women are still at a disadvantage when it comes to getting jobs in the military.
Phụ nữ vẫn còn ở thế bất lợi khi làm việc trong quân đội.
▪ People with previous convictions are always at a disadvantage when on trial in a court of law.
Những người với tiền ác luôn luôn ở thế bất lợi khi tham dự một phiên toà sơ khảo.

children.name: put/place somebody at a disadvantage khiến ai đó ở thế bất lợi
examples: ▪The test put candidates whose first language was not English at a disadvantage.
Bài kiểm tra đưa các ứng cử viên mà ngôn ngữ đầu tiên của họ không phải là tiếng Anh ở thế bất lợi.

children.name: disadvantaged
children.definition: if someone is disadvantaged, they are suffering social or economic disadvantages such as lack of money or bad education, so that they have less chance of being successful than other people: hoàn cảnh khó khăn
examples: ▪The club runs programs for disadvantaged children in the inner city areas.
Câu lạc bộ chạy chương trình cho trẻ em có hoàn cảnh khó khăn ở các khu vực nội thành
the disadvantageddisadvantaged people những ngườicó hoàn cảnh khó khăn
▪Booth invented schemes to help the disadvantaged in the community.
Booth đã phát minh ra các kế hoạch để giúp đỡ những người gặp hoàn cảnh khó khăn trong cộng đồng.

children.name: be handicapped
children.definition: to have a disadvantage that makes it very difficult for you to do something: gặp khó khăn

children.name: be handicapped by something gặp khó khăn bởi cái gì
examples: ▪The Republican candidate was handicapped by his heavy schedule.
Ứng cử viên đảng Cộng hòa đã gặp khó khăn bởi lịch trình nặng nề của mình.
▪ In all its ambitious plans the company has been handicapped by an outdated system of management.
Trong tất cả các kế hoạch đầy tham vọng, công ty đã gặp khó khăn bởi một hệ thống quản lý đã lỗi thời.

children.name: stacked against you
children.definition: the odds are stacked (heavily) against you use this to say that someone has a big disadvantage so that they are very unlikely to be successful: khó khăn chồng chất lên
examples: ▪With every big company in town trying to stop them, the odds are stacked against them.
Với mọi công ty lớn trong thị trấn cố gắng ngăn họ lại, khó khăn đang chồng chất lên họ.
▪ Most people who go into casinos know the odds are stacked heavily against them, but it doesn’t stop them from trying.
Hầu hết những người đi vào đều có khó khăn chồng chất, nhưng điều đó không ngăn cản họ cố gắng.

children.name: be to sb’s disadvantage
children.definition: be to somebody’s  to give someone or something a disadvantage: là điểm bất lợi
examples: ▪Her height could be to her disadvantage if she wants to be a dancer.
Chiều cao của cô ấy có thể là bất lợi cho cô nếu cô muốn trở thành một vũ công.
▪ To its disadvantage, the book contains a lot of material that is difficult for the average person to understand.
Là bất lợi của nó, cuốn sách có nhiều tài liệu rất khó để người bình thường có thể hiểu được.

children.name: to the disadvantage of có điểm bất lợi cho
examples: ▪The government has reorganized the taxation system to the disadvantage of low-paid workers.
Chính phủ đã tổ chức lại hệ thống thuế bởi vì nó có điểm bất lợi cho người lao động có thu nhập thấp.

children.name: be against U
children.definition: be against  if particular conditions are against someone or something, they make it unlikely or impossible for them to succeed in doing something: chống lại
examples: ▪Time is against us. The longer we wait to find a solution to the crisis, the worse it will get.
Thời gian là chống lại chúng tôi. Chúng ta càng chờ đợi lâu hơn để tìm ra một giải pháp cho cuộc khủng hoảng, thì nó càng tệ đi.
▪ He wanted to become a pilot but his bad eyesight was against him.
Anh ấy muốn trở thành một phi công, nhưng thị lực yếu của anh ây chống lại anh.

children.name: count against
children.definition: if something counts against you, it makes people have a worse opinion of you, and often makes people decide not to choose you, or makes them decide that you are guilty: chống lại
examples: ▪We believe Caroline Connely is innocent, but her silence could count against her in a court.
Chúng tôi tin rằng Caroline Connely là vô tội, nhưng sự im lặng của cô có thể chống lại cô trong phiên toàn.
▪ He was a child when he committed the crime. Should that count against him as an adult with a clean record?
Anh ấy đã là một đứa trẻ khi phạm tội. Liệu điều đó có chống lại việc anh là một người lớn với lý lịch sạch sẽ không?

children.name: loss
children.definition: noun

children.name: the best of both worlds
children.definition: a situation in which you can enjoy the advantages of two very different things at the same time
examples: _She works in the city and lives in the country, so shegetsthe best of both worlds.

children.name: bad point
children.definition: nounespecially spokena bad feature that something has: All of these designs have both their good points and bad points.
